greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) = number of distinct n X k toroidal 0..3 arrays.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 48 terms from R. H. Hardin)
S. N. Ethier, Counting toroidal binary arrays, arXiv:1301.2352v1 [math.CO], Jan 10, 2013.
S. N. Ethier and Jiyeon Lee, Counting toroidal binary arrays, II, arXiv:1502.03792v1 [math.CO], Feb 12, 2015.
Veronika Irvine, Lace Tessellations: A mathematical model for bobbin lace and an exhaustive combinatorial search for patterns, PhD Dissertation, University of Victoria, 2016.
formula: T(n,k) = (1/(n*k)) * Sum_{c|n} Sum_{d|k} phi(c) * phi(d) * 4^(n*k/lcm(c,d)). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 27 2017
mathematica: Table[T[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 31 2017, after _Andrew Howroyd_ *)
program: T(n, k) = (1/(n*k)) * sumdiv(n, c, sumdiv(k, d, eulerphi(c) * eulerphi(d) * 4^(n*k/lcm(c,d)))); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 27 2017
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, Jan 10 2011
